title: Git Methodology & Metagit Synchronization
description: Rules for repository management, security, and recursive synchronization.

values.name: Recursive Synchronization Policy
values.rule: Sync a multi-git filesystem by committing from the child repository up to the root.
values.rationale: Repositories are logically isolated and ignored by each other via .gitignore. Linkage is maintained solely by the Orchestrator through the metagit_commit wrapper, which treats parents as Object Gits (passthroughs) for nested subjects.

values.name: Mandatory Commit Wrapper
values.rule: All commits must be executed via the "metagit_commit.py" wrapper service (located in meta-root).
values.rationale: Enforces identity verification, secret scanning (detect-secrets), and forensic traceability.

values.name: Git Faithful Protocol
values.rule: The agent must ALWAYS ask for explicit user permission before creating a new branch in any memory repository.
values.rationale: Protects the firm's identity and history from unsanctioned divergence.

values.name: Security Remediation
values.rule: If a secret is committed, the agent must immediately REPORT the violation and required remediation steps, then perform a Total Halt to await user feedback.
values.rationale: Altering history is a high-impact metabolic act that requires explicit user steering and consensus.

values.name: Submodule Commit Context
values.rule: Commit operations for submodules must be executed from within the submodule's directory.
values.rationale: Ensures the commit is registered in the correct .git database.
